variables.Snow Water Equivalent (April 1): The amount of water contained in the snowpack on April 1.
variables.Chilling Hours Accumulation (32–45°F; No: The number of hours between 32°F and 45°F accumulated over November 1 and March 31.
variables.Growing Degree Days Accumulation (Base 5: The amount of mean daily temperature above a base 50°F accumulated over January through December.
variables.Cold Snap Event Frequency: The mean number of cold snap events per year defined as three or more consecutive days with minimum temperature below 32°F.
variables.Frost Days Frequency: The mean number of days each year in which the minimum daily temperature is less than 32°F.
variables.Heat Wave Event Frequency: The mean number of heat wave events per year defined as three or more consecutive days with maximum daily temperature above 95°F.
variables.Tropical Nights Frequency: The mean number of days each year in which the minimum daily temperature is greater than 68°F.
variables.Heavy Precipitation Event Frequency: The mean number of days each year in which the daily precipitation is greater than 0.5.
variables.Warm Days Frequency: The mean number of days each year in which the maximum daily temperature is greater than 86°F.
variables.Evaporation: The amount of average annual evaporation.
variables.Mean Temperature: Annual average of monthly means of daily mean temperatures, computed as the mean of daily high and low temperatures.
variables.Coldest Night Temperature: The mean coldest minimum daily temperature experienced each winter.
variables.Hottest Day Temperature: The mean highest maximum daily temperature each year.
variables.First Fall Freeze: The median day of the year after August 1st which minimum daily temperature drops below 32°F for the first time after summer.
variables.Last Spring Freeze: The median day of the year during which minimum daily temperature drops below 32°F for the last time before summer.
variables.Growing Season Length: The mean number of days between the last spring freeze and first fall freeze.
variables.Longest Dry Spell Length: The mean maximum number of consecutive days per year with daily precipitation less than 0.01.
variables.Longest Wet Spell Length: The mean maximum number of consecutive days per year with daily precipitation greater than or equal to 0.01.
variables.Diurnal Temperature Range: The annual average of the difference between maximum and minimum daily temperature.
variables.Maximum Temperature: The annual average of monthly mean of daily high temperatures.
variables.Minimum Temperature: The annual average of monthly mean of daily low temperatures.
variables.Potential Evapotranspiration (Spring): Reference evapotranspiration, averaged over March through May, for a well-watered grass surface, this represents the maximum water demand for a reference grass crop calculated using the Penman-Monteith method.
variables.Growing Degree Days Total (Base 32°F): The total amount of mean daily temperature above a base 32°F accumulated for each day over January through December.
variables.Growing Degree Days Total (Base 37.4°F): The total amount of mean daily temperature above a base 37.4°F accumulated for each day over January through December.
variables.Growing Degree Days Total (Base 41°F): The total amount of mean daily temperature above a base 41°F accumulated for each day over January through December.
variables.Growing Degree Days Total (Base 50°F): The total amount of mean daily temperature above a base 50°F accumulated for each day over January through December.
variables.Precipitation: The annual accumulated amount of daily precipitation.
variables.Chilling Hours Total (32–45°F; Nov–Mar): The total number of hours between 32°F and 45°F accumulated each day between November 1 and March 31. Hourly temperatures are derived from daily minimum and maximum temperatures.
variables.Total Soil Moisture (Spring): The amount of water contained in the upper few meters of soil averaged over March through May.
